Created an attachment (id=27707)
HTML Causeing Error fpr Bug 111161

This is the HTML that caused the problem
With which version of WTP (or WST) are you seeing this?  Did it install properly
(this is an odd error to see if so)?
We will need exact versions, install, etc before investigating. 
None of us see this basic problem, so I suspect may be you "overlayed" one
install on top of another, or something, that ended up with an invalid
installation. 

Please provide config file, logs, etc., along with version installed (and method
of installing). 
Created an attachment (id=27804)
Configuration of My eclipse
Thanks much. 

Now for the hard part :) 
I notice you have some plugins (e.g. uri resolver, and org.eclipse.wst.xml.core) 
that show a version 1.0.0. Where did you get those plugins from? We are not
distributing that  (our M8/M9 work still would have it as "0.7.0", as far as I
can tell).. so, its critical that if some other company is doing that
distribution, that they stop ... it will break bad once we do distribute our
1.0.0 version. 

Am I not seeing something right? 

I suspect this "mixed version" is the problem in this case, and not really our
problem, unless I am seeing something wrong. 
Re-opening based on some quick back-and-forth with Steve .... 

Appears "the problem" was that Steve had some "old" plugins of ours 
installed back from the day's when we were distributing it as "1.0". 
And, somehow, happen to class in this particular case. 

If so, this is an unfortunate side effect of us deciding to "move back" version 
to 0.7 from initial milestones which had 1.0. 

So ... I'm closing as "won't fix" .. .I'm not sure what we can do about it now,
even though it is/was a flaw in our "rollout" of plugins. 

I am CC'ing Jeffrey to keep in mind some "installer" scripts for 1.0. 
We *might* want to do some "pre-check" and if any "oldish looking" 1.0 WTP 
plugins were around, to remove those first (or, at least, warn user)? 

I'm not sure how much effort would be needed for this ... so, for now, Jeffrey,
its just an FYI. 
This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old is is assumed its dup, invalid, or worksforme resolution is no longer in qustion and the bugzilla needs no further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error in this case.
